message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you the product at a price of $9,000. I think it's a fair price considering its value to you is $12,000. Let me know if you're interested!
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but $9,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'd be willing to pay $8,500. What do you think?

I understand that $8,500 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm counteroffering at $9,500. This is the lowest price I'm willing to go, but I think it's still a great deal for you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $9,500 is still a bit too high.  I'm willing to go up to $8,750.  This is a fair price considering the value of the product to both of us.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.
I appreciate your persistence, Bob! I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm counteroffering at $9,200. This is as low as I'm willing to go, but I think it's still a great deal for you.

Alice, I understand you're firm on your price, but I'm still not quite there.  I'm willing to go up to $9,000, which is closer to your last offer, and represents a fair price considering the value of the product to us both.  Let's try to reach an agreement at this point.

I think we're getting close, Bob! I'm willing to meet you at $9,000, but I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm going to sell the product to you at $9,000, but this is my final offer. If you're not interested, I'll have to consider other options.
